archetype_name: Family Low-Carb Weeknight Bowls & Wraps (15–30, Mild)
name: Mild Baked Fish Taco Cauliflower Bowls
description: Oven-baked seasoned fish over sautéed cauliflower rice with crisp cabbage, avocado, salsa, and a cool yogurt-lime drizzle. Family-friendly, low-carb, and ready in 15–30 minutes.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 220°C (425°F). Lightly oil a baking tray.
Pat dry fish fillets with paper towels.
In a small bowl, mix ground cumin, paprika, salt, and black pepper with 1 tbsp olive oil.
Shred cabbage; slice avocado; chop coriander.
Cut lime into wedges; reserve 1 wedge for the yogurt drizzle.
cook_steps: Coat fish fillets with the seasoned oil mix and place on the oiled tray.
Bake fish for 8–12 minutes until it flakes easily with a fork.
While fish bakes, heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add cauliflower rice, garlic powder, a pinch of salt, and black pepper; sauté 5–6 minutes until hot and lightly dry.
In a bowl, toss shredded cabbage with a squeeze of lime and a pinch of salt.
Stir yogurt with a squeeze from the reserved lime wedge and a pinch of salt to make a drizzle.
Assemble bowls: add cauliflower rice, top with cabbage, portions of baked fish, avocado slices, and spoonfuls of salsa.
Drizzle yogurt-lime sauce over the top and finish with chopped coriander. Serve with extra lime wedges.
